section.title: Collecting messages from the systemd-journal system log storage
section.para: The systemd-journal() source is used on various Linux distributions, such as RHEL (from RHEL7) and CentOS. The systemd-journal() source driver can read the structured name-value format of the journald system service, making it easier to reach the custom fields in the message. By default, &abbrev; adds the .journald. prefix to the name of every parsed value.
The systemd-journal() source driver is designed to read only local messages through the systemd-journal API. It is not possible to set the location of the journal files, or the directories.

note.para: The log-msg-size() option is not applicable for this source. Use the max-field-size() option instead.
This source will not handle the following cases:

If you are using RHEL-7, the default source in the configuration is systemd-journal() instead of unix-dgram("/dev/log") and file("/proc/kmsg"). If you are using unix-dgram("/dev/log") or unix-stream("/dev/log") in your configuration as a source, &abbrev; will revert to using systemd-journal() instead.

warning.para: Only one systemd-journal() source can be configured in the configuration file. If there are more than one systemd-journal() sources configured, &abbrev; will not start.

section.title: systemd-journal() source options
section.para: The systemd-journal() driver has the following options:

simplesect.title: default-facility()
simplesect.para: Description: The default facility value if the SYSLOG_FACILITY entry does not exist.

simplesect.title: default-level()
simplesect.para: Description: The default level value if the PRIORITY entry does not exist.

simplesect.title: max-field-size()
simplesect.para: Description: The maximum length of a field's value.

simplesect.title: prefix()
simplesect.para: Description: If this option is set, every non-built-in mapped names get a prefix (for example: ".SDATA.journald."). By default, &abbrev; adds the .journald. prefix to every value.
